channel.title: Pre-Built Gaming Laptop? Experts needed!
channel.description:
So my roommate is wondering what laptop he should buy that can handle games like Call of Duty and Max Payne 3, he wants to be able to run the maximum settings possible and without lag. I'm not a computer hardware type of guy, so I don't know what is the best to buy for gaming.
Currently he's looking at laptops like these
http://shop.lenovo.com/us/en/laptops/ideapad/y-series/y510p/
And yes, we can't buy a desktop because our colleges don't allow it for whatever reason. He prefers it pre built so he can just open it up and basically play.
EDIT: He's willing to spend up to $1000 for a gaming laptop.

item.title: Pre-Built Gaming Laptop? Experts needed!
item.dc:creator: @Java-RSPS-Noob Java-RSPS-Noob
item.description:
@Java-RSPS-Noob wrote:

there are three items that matter

  1. GPU ( graphics card ) this is the #1 item. This will show what the laptop is worth.
  2. CPU ( the multi tasking power, can he run this , this, and that all at once? )
  3. Memory ( not really a big deal 8GB is plenty. 1600 + speed is better and suggested.

look here http://www.notebookcheck.net/Computer-Games-on-Laptop-Graphic-Cards.13849.0.html

to see what GPU you need

Unlike common thought an I5 is the best you need. I7’s are mostly used for video editing cause you need that extra power. 4th gens while 10-15% better really aren’t a necessity. (Unsure if 4th gens have arrived in laptops yet)

Read full topic

item.title: Pre-Built Gaming Laptop? Experts needed!

item.description:
@waj wrote:

Go with an MSI if you have enough bucks.

item.title: Pre-Built Gaming Laptop? Experts needed!
item.dc:creator: @kingman002 kingman002
item.description:
@kingman002 wrote:

[quote=“the elve age, post:3, topic:528986”][quote author=kingman002 link=topic=647740.msg4356483#msg4356483 date=1377736587]
inb4 Alienware
[/quote]I’ve heard alienware is crap/cheap[/quote]
No it has good parts and all but it’s just really expensive. If you have the money I would get it but if not then you may have to look elsewhere.

Just looked at chill’s first one from newegg and looks pretty solid.
